content.description: Â Start standing at a horizontal crack on the right side of the boulder about 6 feet above ground. Traverse left the crack turns into a seam, traverse left a few more moves until you can finish straight up when you intersect a faint left leaning dike.
content.location: Starts on the right side of the boulder

content.description: Start on the lowest holds, the furthest out right on the face. Traverse across left on a series of crimps and rails. Make a move across the gap in the rock, and climb up straight to top out. The route tops out the crack, the same as Tomato Crack.
content.protection: A few pads. A spotter towards the end of the climb is a good idea too.
content.location: Located on the Tomato Boulder, you can see this route from the road. Walk on the main loop road, past the trail that leads up to the Mack's Traverse area. The boulder is on your left.

content.description: Start sitting at left facing corner (as for the traverse) and climb straight up on small holds to a high finish.
content.location: Right side of tall face, left of slab.  #2 on the beta topo.

content.description: Climb the crack on the left end of the Tomato Boulder
content.location: The obvious crack on the Tomato Boulder

content.description: Start sitting on bucket under the good traverse holds in the middle of the face.  Climb up and slightly left to a highball finish.
content.location: Middle of face, #3 on the beta topo

content.description: Start sitting to the right of the roof and traverse right on good holds moving up at the Tomato Slab to join obvious good holds to finish all the way right.
Start sitting just to the right of the small roof.  Climb up and slightly left to the same topout as the Right Tomato Highball
content.location: Right of the roof.  #4 on the beta topo

content.description: Someone must have done this before, but I'm adding it here anyways.  Basically a low problem going right from the start of the Tomato Traverse.  Start sitting with right hand in right-most pocket and left on sharp crimp at start of the Tomato traverse.  Fire right hand to sharp pinch on the rail to the right, left hand to another sharp crimp, then work the rail up and right to the jug, topout on easy highball slab.  I used the big obvious foothold, would be way harder without.  Did I mention that the holds on this problem are sharp???
content.location: Right of start of Tomato traverse

content.description: This climb is really good for beginners and the crux is committing to the top out.
content.location: The route is in between the two trees but more toward the tree to the right when you're facing the rock.

content.description: Shady. Two trees are about two feet away from the boulder but they don't really get in the way.
